title:Pandapaxxy's Revenant Iron Banner, Nightfall, Trials Weapons
description:Based on https://www.reddit.com/r/sharditkeepit/comments/1gxhy59/revenant_iron_banner_nightfall_trials_weapons/

// Tinasha's Mastery
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Tinasha’s Mastery will probably be one of a few weapons pulling PvE players into PvP. Being a Stasis rocket-assisted sidearm and the first of its kind it will definitely stand out amongst loadouts. Chill Clip and either Impulse Amplifier or Loose Change will be the standout perk combinations but One for All or Frenzy are more neutral damage options." Recommended MW: Blast Radius or Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=480368036&perks=3525010810,1380253176,951095735,2978966579

// Tinasha's Mastery
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "While I'd advise against a rocket-assisted sidearm for the crucible, having ChillClip on an easy to fire weapon is undeniably strong. While you would need to stock up on ammo it's not entirely outside of the question to use." Recommended MW: Blast Radius.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Archon's Thunder
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Archon's Thunder is not what I had expected with the Iron Banner reprise but it's a nice surprise nonetheless. Envious Assassin or Fourth Time’s the Charm will get you some ammo back respectively. While Onslaught and Killing Tally both give damage in different ways. If you really wanted as much ammo back as possible the Fourth Time's the Charm and Rewind Rounds combo exists for whatever reason and would be funny to see. Unfortunately, high impact machine guns deal pretty bad burst DPS but they have great extended DPS and total damage." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Archon's Thunder
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Archon's Thunder coming back and potentially being the strongest machine gun for the crucible was not on my bingo card. High-Impact Reserves in the third column paired with Onslaught, Killing Tally, Tap the Trigger, Desperate Measures, heck even Target Lock are all great with double damage. Rewind Rounds being in the fourth column can net you some ammo back and Headstone with Rimestealer is a combination all you Stasis fans know of by now." // Rake Angle
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "While I wouldn't recommend glaives for most players it is a niche play style with high risk, high reward. The handful of players with thousands of glaive kills really pad those numbers up for the community. You know what to expect and grind for if PvP is where you're taking Rake Angle. For those outside the know, Replenishing Aegis and Unstoppable Force are great to start with and move on to Close to Melee or Chill Clip depending on your newfound build." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// PLUG ONE.1
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Plug One.1 will find its natural home in the crucible. Under Pressure or the new Lone Wolf Perk both boost it's feel and effectiveness while Slideways will boost feel pairing best with Kickstart. If you don't like Kickstart you can instead go for Closing Time which you should be at the bottom half of the mag most of the time." Recommended MW: Range or Charge Time.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Yesterday's Question
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Yesterday's Question is Tomorrow's Answer. Am I going to repeat that with our next weapon? You bet your butt! This hand cannon is interesting with Dragonfly in the third column allowing for boosted damage into Desperate Measures or more chaining with Voltshot. You can have the energy equivalent of Warden's Law with Fourth Time's the Charm and Vorpal Weapon even with the reduced efficiency on Lucky Pants builds." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Yesterday's Question is Tomorrow's Answer. Am I going to repeat that with our next weapon? You bet your butt! This hand cannon is interesting with Dragonfly in the third column allowing for boosted damage into Desperate Measures or more chaining with Voltshot. You can have the energy equivalent of Warden's Law with Fourth Time's the Charm and Vorpal Weapon even with the reduced efficiency on Lucky Pants builds." // Yesterday's Question
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Heavy Burst hand cannons haven't been the strongest in PvP and with recent buffs they still feel like they're missing something. A push too far in one direction or another could make them instantly top hand cannons or completely irrelevant, I don't know what Bungie wishes to do. What felt best to me was a combination of Rapid Hit and Zen Moment, when I hit crits the gun felt so smooth." Recommended MW: Range or Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Yesterday's Question (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Heavy Burst hand cannons haven't been the strongest in PvP and with recent buffs they still feel like they're missing something. A push too far in one direction or another could make them instantly top hand cannons or completely irrelevant, I don't know what Bungie wishes to do. What felt best to me was a combination of Rapid Hit and Zen Moment, when I hit crits the gun felt so smooth." Recommended MW: Range or Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Yesterday's Question
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Heavy Burst hand cannons haven't been the strongest in PvP and with recent buffs they still feel like they're missing something. A push too far in one direction or another could make them instantly top hand cannons or completely irrelevant, I don't know what Bungie wishes to do. What felt best to me was a combination of Rapid Hit and Zen Moment, when I hit crits the gun felt so smooth." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Yesterday's Question (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Heavy Burst hand cannons haven't been the strongest in PvP and with recent buffs they still feel like they're missing something. A push too far in one direction or another could make them instantly top hand cannons or completely irrelevant, I don't know what Bungie wishes to do. What felt best to me was a combination of Rapid Hit and Zen Moment, when I hit crits the gun felt so smooth." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb
